headline: Foolproof Flat Iron Steaks
description: This recipe for flat iron steaks calls for a mixture of balsamic vinegar, garlic, and thyme. It is basically foolproof.
name: Foolproof Flat Iron Steaks

recipeInstructions.text: Place steaks, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, green onions, garlic, soy sauce, thyme, mustard, and black pepper in an extra large resealable plastic bag, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Knead the bag with your hands to distribute ingredients evenly and completely coat the steaks. Marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
Preheat grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate. Remove steaks from refrigerator and let sit at room temperature for 10 minutes.
Remove steaks from bag and discard marinade.

Cook steaks on the preheated grill until they start to firm and are reddish-pink and juicy in the center, 6 to 7 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 130 degrees F (54 degrees C). Remove steaks to a plate and let rest for 5 minutes before slicing.

review.reviewBody: Great marinade! Typically have all the ingredients listed!I believe you could use it on chicken as well!

This marinade is wonderful!!! It gave the meat such a great flavor, and you could cut the steaks with a feather they were so tender!!!!

I had no fresh thyme, and used dried. I think the flavor came through just enough!
Made a half recipe; the marinade is easy!
Absolutely delicious and very easy! Second time I’ve made this - very well received - will definitely do again!
I made no changes, it was very good
Very tender.. perfect to put on salad
Made this recipe exactly as written. It was delicious! So simple. Now it is my go-to flat-iron steak recipe.
Never prepared flat iron before. The marinade was delicious. I had just a one pound piece. I grilled it 6 min on one side and 5 on the other. Done perfectly. Very tender. Will make again.

My husband and I absolutely LOVE this marinade and I have gotten rave reviews from everyone who has ever tried it too! The meat turns out so flavorful and tender every time. HIGHLY RECOMMEND and thanks so much for sharing!

The weather didn¹t cooperate the night we were planning to have this steak, so I held it over until the next night. It marinated for a total of 32 hours. I made this as written, but omitted the thyme, as a personal
preference. No problem, the flavor was great! Although I did make this with a flat iron steak, I’m not a big fan, so next time I'll make this using a different type of steak. This is a five star marinade!
I followed the recipe minus the time and the meat was tender and some of the best Ive had. Everyone loved them!

I love this marinade! I only had time to marinate the beef for about an hour, which I often find is not long enough for the flavors to soak in. However, the steak was nicely seasoned and the aroma on the grill was wonderful. I'll definitely be trying the marinade on other cuts of meat.

Flat iron steak can be very tender if not overcooked and if cut across the grain. However, it's not a very flavorful steak by itself (at least in my opinion). I followed this recipe as given, and it was very tasty.
This was fine, but nothing special. I marinated overnight and the meat was nicely seasoned.

Delicious! I marinated mine all day, and used a bit of Italian seasoning in place of the thyme b/c I did not have any on hand. I sliced this for on top of our steak salads, and that was wonderful. Moist and tender with a great flavor...a definite keeper~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)
